alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A gusty outflow boundary will impact portions of southwestern Pocahontas, southeastern Nicholas, Raleigh, southwestern Webster, north central Wyoming and Fayette Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 959 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gusty outflow boundary, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Summersville, Fayetteville, Richwood, Babcock State Park, Oak Hill, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Sophia, Camden-On-gauley, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Bradley, Shady Spring, Beaver, Piney View, Stanaford, Coal City and Prosperity. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 58. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 136. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Fayette; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
